intro: Pavetta muiriana, commonly known as the African pavetta, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and feature white to pale pink petals. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, smooth seeds.
